attributes.action: To consider reducing the number of MP's to a number more relevant to the total UK electorate.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of the current general financial restraints affecting all sectors in the UK, coupled with the recent salary increase demand by MP's of up to £20,000, it is time for Parliament to seriously debate the need for up to 650 Members to represent the electorate of the UK. A comparison with similar democracies throughout the world based on electoral sizes, suggests the UK's should be reduced by up to a half.
